abstract: New York Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman and residents of Wall Street luxury condominium tower reach separate settlements with developer Africa Israel Investments Ltd, which had been sued for abandoning renovations or building promised amenities after 2008 financial crisis; developer will have to resolve defects at several buildings and pay fine to the city for improperly taking tax breaks.

headline.print_headline: Developer Reaches Settlements Over Luxury Buildings That Were Left Unfinished
headline.main: Developer Reaches Settlements Over Luxury Buildings That Were Left Unfinished

snippet: Africa Israel Investments Ltd. drew buyers to one of the condo buildings with promises of a terrace, an indoor swimming pool and other amenities, but abandoned the renovation when the economy crashed.
lead_paragraph: Africa Israel Investments Ltd. drew buyers to one of the condo buildings with promises of a terrace, an indoor swimming pool and other amenities, but abandoned the renovation when the economy crashed.
